page.title: 02Long Lane Farm,Touchen End.
page.content: This farm with it's 30 acres is owned and run by a lady whose father owned it until his death.This lady is a keen {conservationist}and{no insecticides} are used.There are 15 cows and 11 calves-four being the{rare breed}the Belted Galloway and the remainder are Devon Reds.All are raised as prime beef mainly for export.The cows are single suckle cows which means no milking is done.Cereals are not grown and hay making of the rye grass is contracted out.Also on the farm are 2 piglets,32 Pure Maran or Rhode Island Red/Light Sussex chicks,4 goslings and 2 geese.We saw a dew pond in the corner of a field.It was overgrown and few creatures live in it.The pond is built on a bed of London clay.The lady wants to encourage wild flowers,birds, insects and creatures to flourish on her farm.
